column2: China Quarantines Wuhan to Prevent Spread of Coronavirus
column4: Chinese authorities are placing the city of Wuhan under quarantine in an attempt to slow the outbreak of a new coronavirus that originated in the city. The state-ownedÂ China Dailyannounced that trains and flights to Wuhan would be temporarily suspended.

column2: 'Dr. Phil' talk show will tape without audiences
column4: LOS ANGELES (AP) — The "Dr. Phil" daytime talk show will tape without a studio audience for roughly two weeks as a precaution against the new coronavirus. The show typically tapes with an audience of about 300 people at Paramount Studios in Los Angeles.

column2: Inside Futures: Relevant trading-focused information authored by key players in the futures, options and forex industries
column4: Watch us on RFD-TV, tomorrow at 9:45am CT! Broad Market Outlook: Outside markets rallied hard last week, dismissing the concerns over coronavirus. We were looking for the market to stabilize, but the rally to new all-time highs was even surprising for us.

column2: Coronavirus passed on within UK for first time as 20th case confirmed there
column4: A 20th patient in Britain has tested positive for coronavirus in the first transmission within the UK. Chief medical officer Professor Chris Whitty said it was not yet clear if the illness had been passed on from somebody who had recently travelled abroad.

column2: What we know about the five New Zealand coronavirus patients
column4: About one in 50 die. The risk of catching covid-19 from someone with no symptoms is very low, because the virus spreads via droplets expelled by coughing. However, it is possible to catch the disease from someone with very mild symptoms, including a cough.
